entry.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Hasek wins second gold as Splittorff take women’s Mass start title
entry.summary: Jan Hasek (CZE) won his second gold medal in two days when the CX80 WMTBOC-athletes raced the mass start on Wednesday. Among the women, the leader in the World Cup, Nikoline Splittorff (DEN), was the fastest and became world champion. Yesterday’s nice weather was replaced by rain when the athletes were sent off into the […]

entry.summary: Ruska Saarela (FIN) and Jan Hasek (CZE) won the first gold medals at the 2024 CX80 World MTBO Championships, which began in Bulgaria on Tuesday. entry.title: North American O champs | Ontario, Canada
entry.summary: At the beginning of August, Gene and I competed in the Canadian Orienteering Championships and North American Orienteering Championships. These were held in Ontario, Canada, and consisted of a middle and long distance race at Mansfield (Canadian Championships); a sprint, sprint relay and knockout sprint in Kingston (North American Championships); and a middle and long […] North American O champs | Ontario, Canada first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: World University Champs | Bankso, Bulgaria | 1-6 July
entry.summary: WUOC was a fun-spirited event designed for university students, but the competition was very fierce, with a large number of WOC-level runners. The team felt it was refreshing to race against athletes who were also students, as opposed to the full-time professionals seen in the World Cup and WOC. Unfortunately, some team members faced illness and […] World University Champs | Bankso, Bulgaria | 1-6 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Oceania 2025 | Entries open! Plan your trip
entry.summary: The warm-up events on the 18th and 19th are just outside New Plymouth, Taranaki, which is about half-way between Auckland and Wellington. Driving time is approximately 4.5 hours from either end, and domestic flights to New Plymouth airport take about one hour. After you’ve warmed up on Taranaki’s middle and long distance, it’s another 3 hours’ […] Oceania 2025 | Entries open! Plan your trip first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: NZ MTBO champs 2025 |11-14 April | Otago
entry.summary: Bring your bike and allow time arrive in the South Island way before Nationals because the MTBO nationals is planned for the weekend before Easter. entry.title: Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport
entry.summary: The protégé effect is a learning phenomenon where teaching and preparing to teach information to others helps a person learn that information. Jakob has fast tracked his knowledge of orienteering super-fast by growing his knowledge as he introduces the sport to others in the community. Jakob Abernethy began orienteering three years ago in Year 8, inspired by […] Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: 2024 Manawatū Schools’ Relay Champs report
entry.summary: On August 2nd, the Red Kiwi Orienteering Club hosted the second Manawatū Schools’ Relay Championships. This year, we saw participation from 246 students across 25 schools, marking an increase of 60 students and 6 new schools from last year. Leading up to the event, club members visited interested schools to teach orienteering skills through classroom […] 2024 Manawatū Schools’ Relay Champs report first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Euro MTBO | Bike fitness and mental agility required
entry.summary: Orienteering is known to enhance brain health and longevity. Rob Garden tested the new knee by pushing hard on the pedals during the Masters MTBO. entry.title: Autopilot | MTBO NZ mapboard importer
entry.summary: Did you know that we have a small importer of Autopilot mapboards in NZ . Andrew McNeill is based in Taranaki, and has limited stock but always replaces what he sells. entry.title: EOC 2024 Relay: Analysis, Maps and Results
entry.summary: Norway’s men and Switzerland’s women won the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) relay in Hungary. After very technical orienteering on the middle distance and tricky routechoices on the long distance, the relay was ...

entry.title: EOC: Norway defends men’s relay title, Switzerland wins women’s race
entry.summary: Norway’s men defended their relay title and Switzerland took the women’s gold when the European Orienteering Championships came to an end on Tuesday afternoon. entry.summary: The big favourites Kasper Fosser (Norway) and Tove Alexandersson (Sweden) took clear victories at the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) Long distance in Hungary – both with a margin of around 4 minutes to their closest competitors. In the men’s class Daniel Hubmann (Switzerland) took an impressive silver medal – 18 years after he took his ...

entry.title: EOC 2024 Middle: Analysis, Maps and Results
entry.summary: Eirik Langedal Breivik (Norway) and Simona Aebersold (Switzerland) won the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) Middle on very technical, Hungarian terrain that really challenged the runners. We saw big mistakes by many athletes, with Breivik and Aebersold managing to navigate well in the steep hills while keeping high speed. In the men’s class Kasper Fosser (Norway) ...

entry.title: Park Street Update: Events August 27-September 2

entry.title: EOC 2024: All You Need To Know
entry.summary: Challenging forest terrain, interesting routechoices and high temperatures await as European Orienteering Championships (EOC) start in Hungary on Friday with Middle Qualification. The world’s top orienteers return to the forest when the 2024 European Orienteering Championships ...
